.class public auto ansi sealed PowerModeChangedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub PowerModeChangedEventHandler(sender As Object, e As PowerModeChangedEventArgs)
public delegate void PowerModeChangedEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, PowerModeChangedEventArgs ^ e);
type PowerModeChangedEventHandler = delegate of obj * PowerModeChangedEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: The source of the event. When this event is raised by the class, this object is always .
A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you create a <xref:Microsoft.Win32.PowerModeChangedEventHandler> delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event-handling method, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event-handling method is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event-handler delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
